column5: Most bait shops that sell by the pound figure that there are 14 dozen large leeches in a pound. Cross some eyes, Dick
Does anyone have an idea of how many leechs are in a pound? Thanks in advance for the help. Atlanta dave
Depends on the size. For Medium I would say 150-200, small 200-300. Hope this helps.

Not going to be much more help with my answer either. It depends on what size you get. We use med-large so the pound/man/week recommendation is fairly close if you only use leeches for bait for the week. If you went with the jumbo size, may not be enough.
I see Aaron is a faster typer than I am!
I use the 1/2 lbs per day/per guy rule. We use Jumbos and this cuts it pretty close.
Wouldn't there be another part of the equasion? How many fish do you plan on catching? I know several lakes where one leech per day is plenty!!! I find then too often.

dear atlanta dave there r about 180 leeches per pound so for example if 4 guys going for 5 days it would work out to be about 10 leeches a day for each guy...a half pound of leeches should last one guy at least 2 very hard fishing days...hoped this helped
Most bait shops that sell by the pound figure that there are 14 dozen large leeches in a pound. Cross some eyes, Dick
